he: מַאי אוֹנוֹ אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת דִּכְתַב לֵיהּ לִכְשֶׁתִּבְרַח מִמֶּנּוּ אֵין לִי עֵסֶק בָּךְ
text: The Gemara asks: What is the phrase: His document, referring to? Rav Sheshet says that he writes for him as follows: When you will escape from the gentile to whom I sold you, I have no business with you. Consequently, as soon as he escapes his gentile master in any manner, he is entirely emancipated. It may be derived from here that the statement: I have no business with you, is valid with regard to manumission.
